news.title: How to Access Permissionless Finance Securely: A Comprehensive Guide for Institutions
news.subtitle: In this blog, we outline the key factors to consider when evaluating the security of a Web3 wallet, providing a framework that will help institutional investors confidently navigate their journey into DeFi and Web3.

image.title: How to Access Permissionless Finance Securely A Comprehensive Guide for Institutions

childMarkdownRemark.html:
As institutions explore the world of permissionless finance and Web3 innovations, establishing a reliable operational infrastructure are its top priorities. A critical decision that users have to make is determining the best mode of asset custody—whether to choose a licensed full-custody service, self-custody via MPC providers or multisig smart contracts, or a multi-custody approach to diversify risk and optimize returns.

However, safeguarding your assets is just the first step. The next challenge is ensuring secure and reliable connections to Web3, especially when managing millions in on-chain transactions. With so many Web3 wallets (connectors) available, choosing the right one can be daunting.

In this blog, we outline the key factors to consider when evaluating the security of a Web3 wallet, providing a framework that will help institutional investors confidently navigate their journey into DeFi and Web3.

Key Considerations:

1. Security Culture, Audits, and Penetration Testing

  • Engineering Team Expertise: Assess the experience and expertise of the engineering team. What is their track record, and how deeply do they understand Web3 security?
  • Engineering Resources: How many dedicated resources are allocated to the wallet? A well-supported engineering team is crucial for ongoing security and performance.
  • Code Origin: Was the wallet built from the ground up or is it a fork of another open-source project? Building from scratch often implies a more thorough understanding and control over the codebase.
  • Ecosystem Standing: Does the engineering team have influence within the ecosystem? Are other protocols being built with this wallet in mind?
  • Regular Audits: Ensure that the wallet undergoes regular security audits and penetration testing. Look for adherence to high security standards e.g. ISO27001 (Information Security), SOC2 Type 1, Type 2.
  • Dedicated Security Team: A wallet backed by a dedicated security team is more likely to maintain high security standards.

2. Performance and Uptime

  • Incident History: Review the wallet’s track record for incidents where users were unable to transact. How often has this occurred, and what was the impact?
  • Response Time: How quickly did the team resolve any issues that arose? Fast resolution times indicate a strong commitment to user experience and security.
  • Vertical Integration: Is the wallet integrated with an RPC provider to ensure maximum uptime? Integration could lead to more reliable performance.
  • Access to Innovation: Does the wallet offer unrivaled access to permissionless innovation, enabling seamless interaction with the latest DeFi opportunities?

3. Codebase

  • Open Source: A wallet with an open-source codebase offers greater transparency and security. The community can review and contribute to its security.
  • Battle-Tested: Look for a codebase that has been battle-tested over time and across market conditions, with significant assets managed through the wallet.

4. Customer Support

  • Service Level Agreements (SLAs): When issues arise, what SLAs are in place? Quick, reliable support is essential for institutional users.
  • Responsiveness: How quickly does the support team respond to inquiries, and how efficiently are problems resolved?
  • Direct Access: What level of access do users have to the product and engineering teams? Direct channels can be a significant advantage in urgent situations.

5. Pre-Trade Risk Management

  • Transaction Simulation: Does the wallet offer transaction simulation and security analysis before confirming trades? This can prevent costly mistakes.
  • Security Integration: Most wallets offer basic security measures, but look for those that integrate multiple security providers, giving users the broadest possible risk management options.

6. MEV Protection

  • Transactions are MEV protected: Does the wallet provide additional protections against MEV to ensure best execution for users?
  • Custom RPC Endpoint: Does the wallet allow users to choose a custom RPC endpoint, such as a node with Flashbot implementation, to protect against MEV exploitation?

MetaMask Institutional’s (MMI) Security and Performance: A Benchmark

While we can’t speak for other Web3 wallets or connectors, here’s how MMI measures up to the criteria outlined above:

Security Culture, Audits, and Penetration Testing

  • Proven Resilience: MMI shares the same code base as MetaMask, and it has been battle-tested through multiple bear and bull markets since 2016, and garnered the largest market share.
  • Expert Engineering Team: MMI has a team of 100 dedicated engineers focused on maintaining stability, reliability, and performance.
  • Dedicated Security: A world-class security team supports MMI, making it the only enterprise-grade wallet that is SOC 2 Type 1 certified, with Type 2 certification in progress. Consensys is also a ISO27001 (Information Security certificate) company.
  • Transparent Testing: MMI undergoes yearly penetration tests, with results publicly available for user review.

Performance and Uptime

  • Rigorous Testing: The MMI Extension is subjected to the highest level of testing before being released to production.
  • Up-to-date to: MMI is vertically integrated with Infura within Consensys, ensuring optimal uptime and performance.

Codebase

  • Foundational Role: Many Web3 wallets are forks of MMI, meaning they rely on and must maintain and update a derivative codebase.
  • Open Source: MMI's open-source code provides transparency and community-driven security.

Customer Support

  • White-Glove Service: MMI offers a 4-hour SLA and provides users with direct access to the sales and product teams via dedicated Telegram groups.

Pre-Trade Risk Management

  • __Comprehensive Security: __
  • MMI has a native Blockaid integration that provides security alerts that helps safeguard users from diverse attack vectors. With the recent acquisition of Wallet Guard, MMI’s security will be further enhanced, improving scam and drainer detection, to provide a superior real-time protection against malicious dapps and scams, all while preserving privacy and self-sovereignty.
  • Through the power of Snaps, MMI offers transaction simulation and pre-trade risk analysis, leveraging up to 10 different security providers. This allows users to tailor pre-trade security framework to their specific needs, ensuring a customizable and robust defense against potential threats.

MEV Protection

  • Custom RPC Options: MMI allows users to select custom RPC endpoints, including nodes with Flashbot implementation, for enhanced MEV protection.
  • Smart Transaction (Coming Soon): MMI will soon allow users to opt in to its smart transaction feature that natively protects users from harmful forms of MEV, stops transactions from reverting on-chain, and automatically bundles related transactions together to save on gas.

Conclusion: The Importance of Detailed Evaluation

In the fast-evolving landscape of Web3 and permissionless finance, the security and reliability of your chosen Web3 wallet are paramount. While many wallets might seem similar at first glance, a deeper evaluation of their underlying security features, performance history, and customer support infrastructure is crucial for institutions managing significant on-chain assets. Don’t leave your business’s future to chance. By taking the time to thoroughly assess these critical factors, you can ensure that your operations not only meet your business needs but also protect yours and your investor’s assets as you navigate the dynamic world of DeFi. If you’d like to discuss your specific requirements and make an informed decision, the MMI team is here to help and feel free to reach out to us at MMI_Sales@consensys.net.

nodes.title: 10 Things You Can Do with MetaMask Portfolio
nodes.subtitle: Whether you’re an OG or newbie, the Fox is here to make you more powerful in web3. Here are 10 things you can do today in MetaMask Portfolio.

image.title: 10 Things You Can Do with MetaMask Portfolio

childMarkdownRemark.html:
The MetaMask wallet has been around almost as long as web3 itself. Launched in 2016, the Fox has come a long way since then, guided by a mission to connect as many people around the world to the decentralized internet as possible. And we know connecting is just the start - much more than that MetaMask enables you to buy, sell, swap, bridge, stake, and beyond, and it all starts in Portfolio.

MetaMask Portfolio is where you get a clear, comprehensive view of your accounts and wallets across all networks. It’s also where your web3 journey begins. Whether you’ve been using MetaMask for years or even minutes, here are ten things you can do in Portfolio right now:

Ten ways MetaMask Portfolio makes you powerful in web3


1. Manage your digital assets and track performance in the dashboard: Easily view and manage all your digital assets including Ethereum tokens (ERC-20) and non-fungible tokens (NFTs), all from a single, unified interface. Keep an eye on your portfolio's performance over time, with insights into asset distribution, historical transactions, and overall value trends. Remember you can view the balances of any public Ethereum address or ENS. You can also view which airdrops you’re eligible for by using the claim airdrop feature.

How to use the Dashboard on MetaMask Portfolio:




2. Do your taxes: Yes, that’s correct – you can do your crypto taxes directly from Portfolio. All you have to do is connect your wallet and you’ll receive 10% off your tax services with recommended providers like CoinTracker, CoinLedger, ZenLedger, Crypto Tax Calculator, and Koinly:


3. Connect to dapps and explore web3: Access and engage with all the dapps web3 has to offer directly through Portfolio: from decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms like Aave, Uniswap, and Renzo, gaming dapps such as HyperPlay to NFT marketplaces like OpenSea.

4. Swap tokens: Use the built-in swap feature to trade tokens directly within Portfolio, leveraging the best available rates across multiple decentralized exchanges (DEXs).



5. Connect to multiple networks: Beyond Ethereum, MetaMask supports various Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM)-compatible networks, allowing users to switch between networks like Binance Smart Chain, Polygon, Linea, and more.

6. Buy and sell cryptocurrency: Buy cryptocurrencies directly within MetaMask Portfolio using traditional payment methods such as bank transfers or credit cards, and through integrations with third-party providers like Paypal and Revoult. And if you’re ready to sell, Portfolio has you covered, simply connect your wallet and select your method to cash out.




7. Integrate with your hardware wallet: Enhance your security by connecting MetaMask to hardware wallets like Ledger or Trezor from Portfolio, combining the convenience of MetaMask with the robust security of cold storage.

8. Customize privacy settings: Adjust your privacy settings to your preference, including setting up a custom RPC for specific networks, managing connected sites, and reviewing permissions. Learn more about how to configure your privacy settings here.

9. Participate in staking: Stake your crypto directly through MetaMask Portfolio, participating in the decision-making processes of various protocols and earning rewards. In Portfolio, there are three options for staking, Validator, Pooled, and Liquid. The below tutorials show you how easy it is to start staking based on your preference.




10. Bridge tokens: Bridging tokens on MetaMask refers to the process of transferring digital assets or tokens from one blockchain network to another using MetaMask as the interface for the transaction. Bridging tokens is a powerful feature in Portfolio that enhances the interoperability between different blockchain networks, enabling users to leverage the unique advantages of each network.


Coming soon in Portfolio


Transfer assets from centralized exchanges (CEXs) like Coinbase and Binance directly to your MetaMask wallet, or between different accounts within MetaMask itself, with enhanced security and ease. Stay tuned for this feature coming soon in Portfolio.

MetaMask Portfolio not only simplifies the management of digital assets but also opens up a world of possibilities for users to explore and engage with the decentralized ecosystem, all while maintaining a high level of security and user control. Get started today.

nodes.title: MetaMask UI Update: Signature Redesign
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask Extension's new UI update makes reviewing signature requests simpler and clearer.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
We’re excited to introduce our latest UI update for MetaMask Extension, aimed at improving the readability of signature requests.

For All Users: Whether you're new to MetaMask or a seasoned user, you'll notice a fresh, more visually pleasing look when receiving signature requests. This update makes it easier to understand and review the actions you're about to approve.

How It Works: Starting with v12.2 of the MetaMask Extension, you'll see the redesigned interface for Permit and Sign In With Ethereum signatures. Don't worry if you don't see changes right away—we're rolling this out gradually to ensure a smooth transition.

In the coming months, we'll be extending this new UI to more signatures, transactions, and our Mobile app. Stay tuned for these updates!

To keep up with the latest on this rollout and other updates, follow us on Twitter @MetaMaskSupport and keep an eye on our Support Channel.

Want to Learn More? Dive deeper into the world of MetaMask signatures by checking out our support article.

Embrace clarity and enjoy peace of mind. Happy signing!

nodes.title: MetaMask UX Update: Improved Token Insights
nodes.subtitle: The new update provides a comprehensive understanding of your crypto assets with 24-hour percentage changes and detailed financial data per ERC20 token.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
We are excited to introduce two important enhancements to our token management feature:

  1. 24-Hour percentage changes in token lists
  2. Detailed financial data in token details

Your token lists will now display 24-hour percentage changes, allowing you to quickly assess price trends directly in MetaMask. You can also access detailed financial data, including price charts and market cap information, when you click on your ERC20 tokens.

This is now available in MetaMask Extension and is coming soon to Mobile.

The 24-hour percentage change will be visible in the main asset list view, while detailed financial data can be found by clicking on the specific ERC20 tokens.

Whether you're a seasoned investor or new to crypto, having easy access to price trends and detailed financial information helps you manage your portfolio more effectively. You can learn more about it in our support article.

Stay tuned for further updates. Enjoy!
